title: Server connection
content: After changing my password I get the following error message: "Server imap.pt.lu has disconnected. The server may have gone down or there may be a network problem" Thunderbird is running well on my mobile, so why not on my PC? I have tried these things: Internet connection is working (as you can see from this mail) I have checked server settings, they seem okay. I have deinstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird. All to no avail. Can you help me?
creator: chevalier1939

title: El inicio de sension en la cuenta "Microsoft 365" ha fallado.
content:
Buenas. Tengo un problema en una cuenta de Microsoft 365 para empresas.

Si me deja leer correos y sincroniza bien, pero no me deja mandarlos. Me sale el error: "El inicio de sensión en la cuenta "Microsoft 365" ha fallado. El inicio de sesión en el servidor smtp.office365.com con el nombre de usuario xxx@xx.es ha fallado."

Si le doy a reintentar, vuelve a salir. Si le doy a cambiar contraseña, vuelve a salir este mensaje y si le doy a cancelar salta el siguiente mensaje: "Error de envío de mensaje. Falló el envío del mensaje. No se puede identificar al servidor de salida (SMTP) smtp.office365.com. Compruebe la contraseña y verifique el 'Método de identificación' en 'Configuración de cuentas | Servidor de salida (SMTP)'."

La contraseña es correcta. He probado a eliminarla en las opciones del thunderbird y entonces cuando le doy a enviar el correo me pide la contraseña y realizar la autentificación de dos pasos de Microsoft. Me autentifica correctamente pero al paso de los segundos me salta de nuevo ese mensaje de error de inicio de sesión. He cambiado la contraseña en Microsoft, la he borrado en thunderbird, me he vuelto a loguear y nada. Todo igual.

La configuración me la detecta correctamente Thunderbird al seleccionar el modo de correo IMAP. La configuración es la siguiente para el servidor de correo saliente: Nombre del servidor: smtp.office365.com Puerto: 587 Seguridad de conexión: STARTTLS Método de autentificación: OAut2 Nombre de usuario: mi correo bien escrito.

Dentro de la configuración de Microsoft (soy el administrador), tengo habilitado la opción IMAP y SMTP autentificado. En la configuración de Azure, tengo la aplicación correctamente creada, con su ID y aprobados a nivel de administrador los 4 permisos que me pide. El el log de conexiones de esa aplicación, me aparece que he sido logueado correctamente cuando Thunderbird me pide las credenciales.

Ya se me acaban las ideas. He contactado con el soporte de Microsoft pero me dicen que no dan soporte a otras aplicaciones y que me busque la vida (con palabras más amables). Que más puedo mirar, que más puedo comprobar?

Agradecería una ayuda y muchas gracias por adelantado :D
creator: maguerxombie

title: Not able to configure Thunderbird in Wondows 10
content:
Hey,

I have downloaded the latest version of TB, and installed it on my PC, but not being able to configure it with my Gmail id. I have tried using automatic setup and manual, but every time it shows "Unable to login at server. Probably wrong configuration, username, or password."

I am giving the correct username and password. I have tried different setups for configuration and even tried configuring offline; however, nothing seems to work.

I have added TB in my Firewall settings, so the issue is not coming from there as well.

Could anyone please help? This is my first time using TB, and I will greatly appreciate any help from the community.
creator: gopchu.grants

Other emails arrive with the attachments intact, but not this one. The email I'm referring to is a once-weekly report sent from my own web-host.

title: NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED: Component returned failure code: 0x8052000b
content:
I have many errors of this kind, e.g.: 

NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED: Component returned failure code: 0x8052000b (NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED) [mozIStorageStatement.executeStep] 2 SQLiteDirectory.jsm:440    getCardFromProperty resource:///modules/SQLiteDirectory.jsm:440    cardForEmailAddress resource:///modules/AddrBookDirectory.jsm:461    cardForEmailAddress resource:///modules/AddrBookManager.jsm:562    updateRecipient chrome://messenger/content/header-fields.js:469    set recipient chrome://messenger/content/header-fields.js:439    buildRecipients chrome://messenger/content/header-fields.js:243    buildView chrome://messenger/content/header-fields.js:210    outputEmailAddresses chrome://messenger/content/msgHdrView.js:1427    UpdateExpandedMessageHeaders chrome://messenger/content/msgHdrView.js:1267    onEndHeaders chrome://messenger/content/msgHdrView.js:559    processHeaders chrome://messenger/content/msgHdrView.js:713

How I diagnose and fix?

title: Around 30% of the emails I send get returned. If I resend, it always works.
content:
Around 30% of the emails I send get returned. If I resend, it always works. I am using Thunderbird 102.10.1 (64-bit) on OpenSuse Leap 15.4 The returned message is eg. 

     This is an automatically generated Delivery Status Notification.

Delivery to the following recipients failed permanently: 

  * rachel.a.drysdale@gmail.com

Reason: A message that you sent to the following recipient could not be delivered due to a permanent error. ** The remote server ?? responded with: ** rachel.a.drysdale@gmail.com ??:?? This message was created automatically by mail delivery software on the server .


Reporting-MTA: dns; avasout-ptp-003 [84.93.230.244] Received-From-MTA: dns; [192.168.0.30] [212.159.97.201] Arrival-Date: Fri, 05 May 2023 11:11:17 +0100


Final-recipient: rfc822; rachel.a.drysdale@gmail.com Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550-5.7.26 This mail is unauthenticated, which poses a security risk to the

Last-attempt-Date: Fri, 05 May 2023 11:11:17 +0100

I compared the source for the failed message and that for the successfully re-sent message. The significant difference seems to be that order of items in the header changed: FAILED: Subject To Ref Content-Language From

SUCCEEDED: From Subject To Ref Content-Language


Does anyone have an idea about this?
creator: riq

title: Thunderbird deleted all my Sent Emails
content:
A couple of days ago my Sent folder went missing. Just wasn't there. So I rebooted, and it came back. But, all my emails were just blank. It showed data under the "size" column and to: and from: and subject were all there. But the body of the message was just blank. Today I discovered the "repair folder" and I did that - and now all the emails are gone.

I will have to find an older backup and restore, but I'm wondering is this a common issue? What should I do in the future? I'm using Pop3 - and had 47,000 in my sent folder. I have many more in other folders that are working fine. Was this just a freak thing? Or should I worry about it in other folders?
creator: m311

title: 'Bringing Folder Up to Date'
content: I've been using Thunderbird for a little over 3 years and I cannot seem to find a solution to this issue. Been around since version 91.0 and on. I cannot get messages to download until all of my folders have been brought 'up to date'. When I check my activity manager it seems like Thunderbird is re-downloading messages that have already been downloaded. This goes on for about an hour or two, and then everything starts working like normal. But can be very frustrating as I am unavailable for the first hour or two of my work day. Have tried troubleshooting mode, safe mode, and installing updates does not seem to fix. Any other ideas?

title: backing up Hotmail account
content: Hello, I wonder if you can help me, I have always used Hotmail for my emails, however I have now exceeded the data allowance and unless I pay a subscription my account is frozen. I do not wish to loose my email inbox and I'm looking at ways to back this up. I have downloaded the latest version of Thunderbird as I have read very good reviews about it, could I ask, will I be able to download my Inbox Sent Items etc emails from outlook.com to Thunderbird in order to save them and then delate them from outlook.com and therefore save all my inbox etc to my hard drive? If So how do I do this and what folder on my computer will they be saved in. I'm sorry to ask what might seem a very stupid question but I'm a disabled OAP in poor health and I really need to have my emails backed up safely before I start deleting them from my Outlook.com account. If you could advise me I should be most grateful. Kindest regards. Gerald

title: Thunderbird keeps moving emails from eBay to my Spam folder
content:
Hi

I have been a user of Thunderbird for quite a few years now, but have suddenly started having an issue I cannot resolve.

Thunderbird keeps dumping all my eBay emails in my spam folder, even when I mark the messages as not spam and even though the eBay mail address is in my address book and Thunderbird is set to not mark messages as span if the send is in my address book.

I have even tried to turn off all spam filtering controls and that made no difference, I also do not have any message filters set up.

Anyone got any idea as to what is going wrong,

Thanks for any help or advice.

Paul

title: need instructions for use of Export and Import
content:
Dear Tbird experts,

I have an old sluggish Win 10 laptop and need to move my three e-mail accounts to the new Win 11 laptop. There seemed to be several techniques in this forum but I thought the Export and Import tools would be the most direct way. Please clarify with a definition of a "profile" since most threads talk about moving a profile to another machine. I have already used the Export tool on the old laptop and copied the zip file it created to the new laptop. The snag is that in my haste to use e-mail on the new laptop, I recreated the same three e-mail accounts on the new laptop, so both laptops have been getting the same e-mails. Before I use the Import tool on the new laptop, what do I need to do about the accounts on the new laptop? I noticed that for each e-mail account, there is an Account Settings button that leads to an Account Actions menu with Remove Account as an option. How should I proceed? It would be more helpful if these tools had a prologue that explained what the process was and helped set expectations. Unlike installation exe files, I do not feel totally sure about what will happen during Export and Import. Yours, Michael F
creator: Mike_NH

title: Unrecoverable password
content: My previous host changed its system without notification and my Thunderbird client went dead. I moved to a new host provider and forgot to note my password. Now I can not reinstall Thunderbird because I do not have the password. Can I recover that password or open a new account with a different password??

title: Getting Tbird to recognize my old profile
content:
I just upgraded my computer (W7 -> W11) and downloaded Tbird. I backed up my old profile (16.4GB) and now I am trying to get Tbird to recognize it. I closed the program and ran the profile utility and I'm trying to follow these directions I found in an earlier post:

you will get a small window titled "Thunderbird - Choose User Profile" [got it] Uncheck "Use the selected profile without asking at startup" [did it] highlight the profile name you want to use. (try the new one first) [not there]

The problem is that it does not show my old profile name at all, even though it is in the same location (/Profiles) as the new ones Tbird created automatically when I entered my login info. Do I use the "Delete" to get rid of the new ones, or "Rename", or something else?

Thanks.
creator: tonyalt1
